name: Ladder Sets (1-2-3 up to 3-2-1)
time_per_session_breakdown: Perform cyclical reps in ascending then descending order
overview_and_execution: Do 1 rep, rest, 2 reps, rest, 3 reps, rest, then repeat. Possibly up to 5 reps. This is one ladder. Do multiple ladders. Often used with limited rest to accumulate volume without burning out quickly.
example_application: Pull-ups: 1 rep, rest ~10s, 2 reps, rest, 3 reps, rest, repeat. If you can’t complete the top rung, reduce the max rung or total ladders.
important_notes: Excellent for practicing submax sets with cumulative volume. Great for skill-based lifts or bodyweight progressions.
volume_metrics: Each ladder rung total: 1+2+3=6 reps. Doing 3 ladders = 18 reps total, etc.
